titleStmt.title: D. S. Lane et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6900

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his Excellency Thos E. Bramlett

Govenor of the Commonwealth of Ky. Your petitioner would most respectfully represent to your excellency that our worthy fellow citizen John Sullivan was at the may Term 1864 of the Trimble Circuit Court fined the sum of sixty dollars for keeping a tipling house in said County of Trimble Your petitioners would say that the said John Sullivan is a farmer & a very poor man that they believe he ought not under the circumstances to have been fined that he the said John Sullivan was at the time of the trial a citizen of the County of Carroll, and residing in that County, that he says to us, & we know him to be a man of Truth, that he had lost or mislaid the Copy of Summons & did not recollect the time Set for his trial, we are his neighbours & know that he was not in the habit & believe he never did sell whiskey or any other liquors in any quantity less than one half Gallon, he having licenses from the Government to do so. we would therefore under the circu Circumstances respectfully ask Your excellency to remit said fine & as in duty bound we would ever pray

D. S. Lane
S. Gatewood
J. F. Young
Pitney Dikins
George Miller
John H. OBrien
Heironimus Fisher
W H Force
R. Kindle
F. A. Adams
Thos Peak
W, H, Gatewood
D. O. Anderson
D R Lan
L. F. Hopwood
A J Bartlett
James Hill
W Stanley

Trimble Cir Ct
vs
John Sullivan
$60,
Tipling
10th Aug/65
